intro: Spilanthes helenioides, commonly known as the Helen's bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other mustard family plants. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and pinnately divided leaves. It typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in desert or semi-desert environments. Spilanthes helenioides is adapted to arid conditions and has a short growing season.
